item.title: Learn to Play Atari Games using Reinforcement Learning
item.description: This is an agent made to learn playing Atari Pong, which runs on the principles of Reinforcement Learning. The code is written in Python using Keras and OpenAI Gym.

item.title: Linux From Scratch
item.description: This project was targeted to make us familiar with the Bash Script (Default Shell), Concepts of Python Language, Linux Architecture and how to work your way around in a linux operating system.

item.title: Android Development
item.description:
ACA Project Markdown File -

By Devanshu Somani(160231) and Niket Agrawal(160446)

In our project, we aimed at learning basic android application developing techniques using Android Studio.

item.title: Mini Projects on Algorithms, Python, Web Dev, Cyber Security Wargames, Machine Learning, Latex
item.description: Project aimed at learning about various fields in computer science and is a good start to knowning various topics like webD, Machine Learning, Cyber-Security(Wargames), etc.

item.title: Game Theory
item.description: It includes zero sum games in which a person plays against computer or 2 persons play against each other using zeromq library. We made two games as part of this project- Tic-Tac-Toe and Connect4. The project consists of two games :-

item.title: ACA Mini-Projects (-Anuj Nagpal)
item.description: This is a composition of many mini-projects. It involved Learning Python, C++, HTML and Basic CSS, Algorithms, Web Scraping, Learning Latex and Introduction to Machine Learning. The coding work is done in C++ language.

item.title: System and Cyber Security
item.description: • Abstract: this project was about learning, exploring and exploiting various security vulnerability in a program. Project was mostly based on system vulnerabilities under “old-style” Linux system.

item.title: Haskell-Crypto
item.description: Tic-Tac-Toe is a single player vs cpu game Mentor : Prannay Khosla Haskell Crypto Tic-Tac-Toe

item.description:

item.title: Contact Us
item.description: @import url(https://fonts.googleapis.com/css?family=Source+Sans+Pro:400,200,200italic,300,300italic,400italic,600,600italic,700,700italic,900,900italic); body { font-family: ‘Source Sans Pro’, sans-serif; line-height: 1.5; color: #323232; font-size: 15px; font-weight: 400; text-rendering: optimizeLegibility; -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased; -moz-font-smoothing: antialiased; } table, th, td { border: none !important; } .heading-title { margin-bottom: 100px; } .text-center { text-align: center; } .heading-title h3 { margin-bottom: 0; letter-spacing: 2px; font-weight: normal; } .p-top-30 { padding-top: 30px; } .half-txt { width: 60%; margin: 0 auto; display: inline-block; line-height: 25px; color: #7e7e7e; } .
